newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst Turkish venture to cost DM145 mln.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst Turkish venture to cost DM145 mln.

text.p: German chemical group Hoechst AG said on Wednesday its planned 50-50 Turkish joint venture to produce polyester yarn and cord would involve a combined investment of around 145 million marks.

The German group is linking up with Turkish industrial conglomerate Sabanci Holding to set up the plant, to be called Hoechstsa, in Izmit, east of Istanbul. Sabanci had announced the plans on Tuesday without giving details.
Hoechst said in a statement that the plant would begin operations at the start of 1999 and would produce around 14,000 tonnes of polyester yarn per year.
Hoechst said it and Sabanci were reacting to the growing global demand for "new generation" polyester yarns.
